instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb activity and hdmi not working
threads.message:
Hello, I have a water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

After replacing <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> and component around like <RESISTOR>R8060</RESISTOR> - <CAPACITOR>C8200</CAPACITOR> - <CAPACITOR>C8201</CAPACITOR> and not the cd3215C00 I got the MacBook working.

After a week I got it back, still charging on all the 4 combinations and fully working except for the data lines and hdmi from the usb-c port.

What should I check/do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb activity and hdmi not working
threads.message:
Remove USB-C connector from chassis and inspect its terminals.
S-UEM2 is recommended to check diode mode to ground on J3300 lines.

Check <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> power rails and surrounding components for corrosion.
